entities.name: Atlantis
entities.definition: Great island empire larger than Libya and Asia, situated beyond Pillars of Heracles in Atlantic Ocean

evidence.quote: there was an island situated in front of the straits which are by you called the Pillars of Heracles; the island was larger than Libya and Asia put together

entities.name: Ancient Athens
entities.definition: Prehistoric Athenian city, first in war and best governed, founded by Athena nine thousand years before Solon's time

evidence.quote: when the city which now is Athens was first in war and in every way the best governed of all cities, is said to have performed the noblest deeds

entities.name: Egyptian Priests
entities.definition: Keepers of ancient records in Sais who preserve knowledge of prehistoric events in temple writings

evidence.quote: he asked the priests who were most skilful in such matters, about antiquity, and made the discovery that neither he nor any other Hellene knew anything worth mentioning about the times of old

entities.name: Solon
entities.definition: Wisest of seven sages, Athenian lawgiver who traveled to Egypt and received ancient story from priests

evidence.quote: a tale which, though strange, is certainly true, having been attested by Solon, who was the wisest of the seven sages

entities.name: Critias the Elder
entities.definition: Grandfather of dialogue's Critias, aged ninety, who heard and preserved Solon's account of Atlantis

evidence.quote: he told the story to Critias, my grandfather, who remembered and repeated it to us

entities.name: Cataclysm
entities.definition: Violent earthquakes and floods occurring in single day and night, causing simultaneous destruction

evidence.quote: But afterwards there occurred violent earthquakes and floods; and in a single day and night of misfortune all your warlike men in a body sank into the earth, and the island of Atlantis in like manner disappeared in the depths of the sea

entities.name: Story Transmission
entities.definition: Sequential passing of Atlantis narrative from Egyptian priests through Solon to Critias family

evidence.quote: I heard from an aged man; for Critias, at the time of telling it, was as he said, nearly ninety years of age, and I was about ten

step1.notes: Entities limited to direct Timaeus mentions

morphisms.statement: Atlantis made unprovoked expedition against Europe and Asia, ended by Athens

evidence.quote: a mighty power which unprovoked made an expedition against the whole of Europe and Asia, and to which your city put an end

morphisms.statement: Egyptian priests informed Solon about ancient Athens and Atlantis conflict

evidence.quote: You are welcome to hear about them, Solon, said the priest, both for your own sake and for that of your city

morphisms.statement: Solon told story to Critias who remembered and repeated it

evidence.quote: he told the story to Critias, my grandfather, who remembered and repeated it to us

morphisms.statement: Earthquakes and floods caused warlike men to sink into earth

evidence.quote: all your warlike men in a body sank into the earth

morphisms.statement: Same cataclysm caused Atlantis island to disappear in sea depths

evidence.quote: and the island of Atlantis in like manner disappeared in the depths of the sea

olog.name: Atlantis Narrative in Timaeus
axioms: Egyptian records preserve what Greek memory has lost through disasters
Ancient Athens exceeded all cities in virtue and governance
Atlantis empire extended dominion over islands and continental parts
Simultaneous cataclysm destroys both victor and vanquished civilizations
Story transmission requires reliable chain from witnesses to present
rules: IF Greeks recount genealogies THEN Egyptians respond with superior ancient knowledge
IF island empire attacks Mediterranean peoples THEN Athens leads resistance alone
IF violent earthquakes and floods occur THEN land armies and sea powers perish together
IF ancient story lacks written record THEN oral tradition preserves essential memory

evidence.quote: you do not know that there formerly dwelt in your land the fairest and noblest race of men which ever lived
your country shone forth, in the excellence of her virtue and strength, among all mankind
in a single day and night of misfortune all your warlike men in a body sank into the earth, and the island of Atlantis in like manner disappeared

omissions: Timaeus lacks architectural details found in Critias dialogue
No constitutional specifics of Atlantis governance mentioned
Absent: Poseidon's role, ten kingdoms, concentric harbors structure
overreach: May imply systematic empire without textual warrant for administrative details
Could suggest organized military without specific evidence in Timaeus
fixes: Restrict Atlantis description to 'great and wonderful empire' terminology only
Focus transmission chain on memory preservation rather than factual accuracy claims
Emphasize Egyptian priests as sources rather than independent historical verification
